intro: Urostachys hystrix, commonly known as the bristly hystrix, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, bristly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Urostachys hystrix is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
